summary: FCSTANDARD/32 is an intelligence source or asset for the CIA, based in Addis Ababa. They have been in contact with CIA Case Officers (C/O) and staff members, providing information on various topics including Sudan, Libya, and the activities of Israeli and Russian delegations. They also provide insights into individuals, activities, and security measures in Addis Ababa. The contacts summarized in the documents occurred around February 25, 1998.
significance: Based on the provided documents, FCSTANDARD/32's significance is related to providing intelligence to the CIA regarding geopolitical matters and regional security in the late 1990s. There is no indication from these documents that FCSTANDARD/32 has any connection to the JFK assassination.
